job description:
We are looking for a passionate, methodical, driven individual that will use our enterprise systems to translate data into information. Transforming that information into insights that will help the business make quick, accurate decisions.

The data scientist will report to the Director of Data Governance and works closely with decision makers on a daily basis to provide guidance and tactical input on executing our data strategy. This individual will develop, maintain and control all aspects of corporate/global data.

Responsibilities

  • Ability to work collaboratively with a cross functional group of business/departmental stakeholders to understand and prioritize business and information needs, then translating those needs into data processes
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
  • Responsible for data mapping sessions with stakeholder groups across the company
  • Management of data assets and ensuring that they are in compliance with data governance standards
  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
  • Data Scientists work closely with clients, data stewards, project/program managers, and other IT teams to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound organizational decisions.
  • Present back their findings to the business by exposing their assumptions and validation work in a way that can be easily understood by their business
  • Develops usage and access control policies and systems in collaboration with the data
  • Work with ETL / data quality / BI / metadata tools
  • Process confidential data and information according to guidelines and privacy legislations
  • Train and assist colleagues in accessing and interpreting data and analysis results

Requirements

  • Proven 5+ years of working experience as a data scientist or business data analyst
  • Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
  • Identifies what data is available and relevant, including internal and external data sources, leveraging new data collection processes
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (business objects etc), databases (sql etc), programming (xml, javascript, or etl frameworks)
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (excel, spss, sas etc)
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
  • Familiar with formal CAB (Change advisory board) change management process, including communication and project management methodology

Competencies

  • Honesty and integrity are at the heart of everything you do.
  • You are not afraid to learn and get your hands dirty by jumping right in and learning the world of Saba, the systems we use and how the business will get value from our data analysis
  • Excellent critical thinking, investigative/analytical skills and strong follow-through capabilities.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate effectively with all levels within the organization and with external stakeholders. Effectively express ideas and convey information in business writing, conversations and interactions with others.
  • Ability to set goals and prioritize work with cross functional groups
  • Change advocate Identifies and acts upon opportunities for continuous improvement
  • Gathers and analyzes information or data on current and future trends of best practice. Seeks information on issues impacting the progress of organizational and process issues.
